content.description: Climb up the block and then work up the face  under the overhang. Climb the overhang and step up to the top.
content.location: At  the  right  facing  corner formed by the large block around the corner from "The Dark Side Of The  Cliff". Climb up the block and then work up the face  under the overhang. Climb the overhang and step up to the top.

content.description: Start at the outside corner between the green and orange face. Climb over two ledges and up a flake which lends right to a left facing inside corner. Follow this corner to the top.
content.location: At the left side of a 30' wide section of orange colored rock. Start at the outside corner between the green and orange face.

content.description:
Climb up the second open book, step right (Var. l), and finish up the right facing corner. 

  Var 1. Pour Toi, Babe   FA: Alex Catlin, Tempest Truman  May 1986   Climb up the face and arÃªte to the left of the regular route.
content.location: At the right end of the cliff is a yellow face by the White Trail. "Down Pour" starts at the second open book at the right of the yellow face.

content.description: Start at the  base of the obvious left facing inside corner with a tree near the top. Follow the clean corner to the top.
content.location: Look for the 30' wide section of orange colored rock. Start at the  base of the obvious left facing inside corner with a tree near the top

content.description: Start at the center of the yellow wall. There is a  large crack to the left and a small one to the right. Climb the face without using the cracks to either side.
content.location: At the right side of the cliff on the last yellow face before the White Trail

content.description: Climb the crack leading up to a ledge with a tree on it. From the ledge, move left to the next crack system to the top. Loose.
content.location: On a large outcrop north of the main cliff. About 3 feet right of an open book (Chriss)

content.description: Climb the blank open book and  the  crack above to the top.
content.location: At the right end of the cliff is a yellow face by the White Trail. "Crack in the Clouds" starts at the first blank open book at the right of the yellow face.

content.description: Climb the open book up through the overhang. Work right to a ledge and a cave with a tree in it. Follow the crack out of the cave to the top.
content.protection: Standard trad rack, no bolts or fixed gear
content.location: On a large outcrop north of the main cliff at an open book capped by an overhang about 5 feet up.

content.description: Climb up to the open book and then work up right on the outside corner.
content.location: Start: 10' to the right of "Arthroscopy" under a small, blank open book with a horizontal crack under it.

content.description: Climb up the crack to the left facing inside corner which is followed to the top.
content.location: The third crack to the right of the yellow wall at the right side of the cliff by the White Trail

content.description: Climb up the crack to the top of the block. Walk left and climb the small left facing corner to its top and then continue to the top.
content.location: At the crack that splits the block around the corner from "The Dark Side Of The Cliff".  There  is a tree growing out of the crack.

content.description:
The cliffs at the Right Knee face west, making them cool in the mornings and warm late in the day. There is an abundance of short easy routes here along with some decent bouldering. Toprope anchoring possibilities are very good. 

  Rock is typical Connecticut traprock but seems more abrasive than at Ragged or Pinnacle
